IAS Personal Knowledge System (Draft)

Louise Andrea R. Tatoy | 3BSIT-5

Hello! Welcome!

This Personal Knowledge System (PKS) is a technical portfolio showcasing my understanding of different topics involving Information Assurance and Security. This is a draft and will soon be added with even more complex yet interesting topics.

They are structured to provide clear navigation through foundational concepts and practical web application security topics. Begin your journey by exploring the primary topic links below:

Topics

# Topic Description Files
1 The Importance of IT Security Information assurance, risk management, and the core CIA triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability). 1
2 Career Opportunities in IT Security Covering the CIA triad, threat actors, and the landscape of cybersecurity job roles (Red Team vs. Blue Team). 2
3 Encryption & Cryptography Fundamentals Principles of cryptography, hash functions, ciphers, and the role of X.509 certificates. 3
4 Cloud & Virtualization Fundamentals Hypervisors, cloud storage varieties, and Cloud Access Security Brokers (CASB). 4
5 Vulnerability: OS Command Injection (CWE-78) Understanding how external input can execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system. 5
6 Vulnerability: SQL Injection (CWE-89) A deep dive into manipulating database queries to steal, modify, or delete data. 6
7 Vulnerability: Cross-Site Scripting (CWE-79) Client-side attacks that inject malicious scripts into web pages to compromise user interactions. 7
